events.message: Customer reported an auto accident involving a collision with a roadside barrier outside the city. The vehicle sustained front-end damage and the driver required assistance.
The reported incident was categorised as an auto accident under the vehicle collision claims, based on customer details and initial description.
An insurance agent was assigned to the case to manage the claim process and serve as the main point of contact for the policyholder.
The insurance company acknowledged receipt of the claim and confirmed that the claim is now under review with all relevant information gathered so far.
Additional documents were requested from the customer, including photos of the damaged vehicle, the police report, and a copy of the driver’s license.
The policyholder submitted all requested documents promptly, including detailed images of the vehicle’s damage and an official police incident report.
A formal investigation was initiated by the claims team to verify the facts surrounding the collision and assess the extent of the vehicle damage.
The investigation concluded with confirmation that the damage was consistent with the customer’s account and eligible under the policy coverage.
Based on the investigation findings, a settlement offer was proposed to the policyholder covering repair costs and applicable compensation.
The customer expressed satisfaction with the proposed settlement offer and confirmed acceptance to proceed with repair arrangements.
The claim was officially approved by the insurer following the customer’s acceptance of the settlement proposal and verification of coverage.
Payment for the agreed settlement amount was issued to the repair shop on behalf of the customer to facilitate timely vehicle restoration.
The claim case was officially closed after confirmation that the repairs were completed and the customer was fully compensated.
All documentation and records related to the auto accident claim were archived for future reference in accordance with company policies.
